markdown: <::PRIORITIZATION PROCESS STEPS EPA Must First Clarify Criteria, Methods, Tools, Approaches, etc. for Prioritization Process Rule - Identify Pool from "Active" inventory and Workplan and Batch. - Connected to: B3, B1, B2, B4 - Public Comment: B1-5. Batches - Progression of Information Gathering (represented by a funnel icon) 1. Reasonably available information 2. Voluntary Call-ins 3. Section 8a and 8d rules 4. Section 4 rules, orders, consent agreements (if necessary, using tiered approach) - Information Screening Bridge - Is information sufficient for priority decision? - Yes --> Sufficient Information to Designate High Priority or Low Priority - No --> Gather/develop information - Is information sufficient for scoping? - Yes --> Sufficient Information to Designate High Priority or Low Priority - No --> Gather/develop information - Gather/develop information - Sufficient Information to Designate High Priority or Low Priority - Yes --> Initiate Priority Designation - No --> Iterate? - Iterate? - Is additional information needed to designate? - Yes --> Progression of Information Gathering - No --> Gather/develop information - Initiate Priority Designation - Propose Priority Designation - Finalize Priority Designation - High Priority - Risk Evaluation - Low Priority - Subject to Judicial Review : flowchart::> Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/jzbn0226 Attachment C
